comments.body: this documentation is supposed to be on `new (a: string)`, not `new (b: number)`.

I took a look at this and it's working as intended following:
> the jsdoc for the first signature of the overload should be applied to all others that do not themselves have jsdoc

Is this an exception to the above rule?
Should this exception only be applied when `useConstructSignatures === true`?

https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/blob/376acadc2df270014b808d832b0eee5f9e2fde65/src/services/symbolDisplay.ts#L222-L226
No, I just missed that rule.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +286,290 @@        marker: "18",
        includes: [
            { name: "i1_i", text: "var i1_i: i1\nnew (b: number) => any (+1 overload)", documentation: "new 1" },
            { name: "i2_i", text: "var i2_i: i2\nnew (a: string) => any (+1 overload)" },
            { name: "i3_i", text: "var i3_i: i3\nnew (a: string) => any (+1 overload)", documentation: "new 1" },

comments.body: same: this documentation is supposed to be on `(a: number)` not `(b: string)`.
same: `(a: number)` is the one with jsdoc, not `(b: string)`
